alert.note: Alert for Cross; Lee; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:41PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lee, western St. Francis and southwestern Cross Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 441 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hunter, or 11 miles north of Brinkley, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Forrest City, Palestine, Caldwell, Wheatley, Moro, Aubrey, Haynes, Garret Grove, Fair Oaks, New Salem, Oak Forest, Slonikers Mill, Westor, New Castle, Goodwin, Heustess, Gill, Hawkins, Horton and Bonair. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas.
